sub-committee-recruitment-2011.name: sub-committee-recruitment-2011
sub-committee-recruitment-2011.title: Sub-Committee Recruitment 2011
sub-committee-recruitment-2011.content:
Dear SCEians,

It’s the start of a new academic year, and also the formation of your new student body committee – come on down to the subcommittee recruitment for the Computer Engineering Club’s 12th Management Committee!.

The details are as follows

Dates-
  • September 5th (Monday) for CSC & BCG Students
  • September 6th (Tuesday) for CE & BCE Students
Time: 5:30pm to 10pm Venue for Registration: Outside SCE General Office

Available Portfolios

The following portfolios need to be filled:
  • Business Manager
  • Publications
  • Publicity
  • Sports & Recreation
  • Logistics
  • Academic Welfare
  • IT
  • Corporate Liaison
  • Social Secretary
  • Events
The MAIN COMMITTEE job scope of each portfolio is also available for your reference!(download here) [fbcomments]

annual-general-meeting-2011.name: annual-general-meeting-2011
annual-general-meeting-2011.title: Annual General Meeting 2011
annual-general-meeting-2011.content:
Dear SCE Students,

Congratulations to all the newly appointed members of the 12th Computer Engineering Club Management Committee! The 12th Management Committee hopes to make your student life here more memorable and convenient with our welfare services and events this year! Please come down to our Annual General Meeting and Investiture Ceremony next Friday to bid farewell to the outgoing 11th Computer Engineering Club Management Committee and welcome the 12th Management Committee. The details are as follows:
  • Date: September 16th, Friday
  • Time: 6.00 pm - 8.30 pm
  • Venue: LT2A
We hope to see you come down and offer your support! [fbcomments]

ia-info-session-talk.name: ia-info-session-talk
ia-info-session-talk.title: IA Info Session Talk
ia-info-session-talk.content:
Dear SCEians,

Worrying about the important points to take note of for your Industrial Attachment? Interested to hear what the seniors have to say about their experiences of going through their Industrial Attachment?

CEC will be organizing an IA Sharing Session specially for SCE students to gain some learning points from the experiences of the Year 3&4s who have already completed their IA.

Details of the IA Sharing Session are as follows.

Date: 2nd February (Thursday)

Time: Registration starts from 530pm

Venue: LT 6 (North Spine)

Guest Speaker: Assoc Prof. Deepu Rajan, IA coordinator, SCE

There would be speakers from Merrill Lynch, Barcap, Accenture, Paypal and more. Speakers will be speaking and sharing their IA experiences from different aspects of the industry. There will also be a short Q&A segment to round up the session, and dinner will be provided as well.

Registration is now open till 1st February (Wednesday).

Please RSVP at https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dGJGZkhpbnJHMHpKRDk0UF9UemtGb3c6MQ

Best Regards,
12th Management Committee,
School of Computer Engineering Club

[fbcomments]

sce-movie-screening.name: sce-movie-screening
sce-movie-screening.title: SCE Movie Screening
sce-movie-screening.content: Dear SCEians, Call to all SCE STUDENTS include undergrads & graduates to SIGN UP for our FANTISTIC MOVIE SCREENING on Feb 17th @ Golden Village Grand $5 = Movie($11.5) + Popcom Combo($7.90) + Luck Draw($$) + Free Shuttle($$) + Your Love For Charity($$$$$) Please register with your name, matric No. by 10th Feb 2012 @ https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dGRCdnJvR0pFSF9PSnlXc2h1VF9TaFE6MQ The capacity is 120pax and will be reserved on first come basis. Best Regards, 12th Management Committee, School of Computer Engineering Club [fbcomments]

merrill-lynch-ia-recruitment-talk.name: merrill-lynch-ia-recruitment-talk
merrill-lynch-ia-recruitment-talk.title: Merrill Lynch IA Recruitment Talk
merrill-lynch-ia-recruitment-talk.content: Dear SCEians Here's a chance for you to hear from Merrill Lynch, one of the leading financial institute. If you are graduating in 2013 or 2014 and/or looking for Industrial Attachment (Jul-Dec 2012) opportunities, we welcome you to join us at the event and meet with employees from Merrill Lynch. Date: 13 February 2012, Monday Time: 6:00 - 8:00pm, On-site registration starts from 5.30pm Venue: LT 7 Dress Code: Formal Dinner will be provided as well The following registration link will be closed on 13th Feb, 12pm. To register, please proceed to: https://wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/REGISTER_NTU.REGISTER?EVENT_ID=OA12020913473266 Best Regards, 12th Management Committee, School of Computer Engineering Club [fbcomments]

peer-tutoringstg-and-peer-coaching-semes.name: peer-tutoringstg-and-peer-coaching-semester-1-ay-201213
peer-tutoringstg-and-peer-coaching-semes.title: Peer Tutoring(STG) and Peer Coaching Semester 1 AY 2012/13
peer-tutoringstg-and-peer-coaching-semes.content:
Dear SCEians,

We have these classes opened for Student-Led Tutorial Group (STG):
Day Course Code Course Name Venue
Monday CE/CZ1001 Discrete Mathematics TR19
CE/CZ2005 Operating Systems TR20
CPE301 Digital Communications TR21
Tuesday CE/CZ1005 Digital Logic/Logic Design TR+7
CPE303/CSC206 Database Systems TR+8
CS302 Net-Centric Computing TR+9
Wednesday CE/CZ2001 Algorithm TR+1
Thursday CE/CZ1003 Intro to Computational Thinking TR15
CPE303/CSC206 Database Systems TR18
CE/CZ1008 Mathematics 1/Engin Maths TR16
CZ2003 Computer Graphics & Visualization TR17
All classes are 6.30pm to 8.30pm, commencing Monday, 5th Sept 2012.
All are welcomed! Do join us!

sce-dance-troupe-recruitment.name: sce-dance-troupe-recruitment
sce-dance-troupe-recruitment.title: SCE Dance Troupe Recruitment
sce-dance-troupe-recruitment.content:
Hi SCEians!   This is a shout out to all the students who wish to groove and shake a leg. We are recruiting for SCE's first ever dance troupe! You don't have to be a professional to be a part of the team. You don't even need to know much dance! All you need to have, is the willingness to have fun!   Now is your chance to stay fit, dance your heart out and be active part of SCE!   We expect to see you tonight at our last audition!   Date: 28/9/2012 Friday Time: 5pm - 8:30 pm Venue: TR21
Best regards,
Computer Engineering Club
13th Management Committee

sce-harcharan-singh-sports-carnival-2012.name: sce-harcharan-singh-sports-carnival-2012
sce-harcharan-singh-sports-carnival-2012.title: SCE Harcharan Singh Sports Carnival 2012
sce-harcharan-singh-sports-carnival-2012.content:
Hi SCEians, Our 13th Annual Sports Carnival - HARCHARAN SINGH INTRA SCHOOL SPORTS CARNIVAL is here again! We will be featuring 10 exciting games this year for both genders.   Lucky Draws will be conducted every day and you will stand a chance to win these attractive prizes when you participate in the games. Last but not least, you might be the one who will bring home an iPod or USS tickets from our Grand Lucky Draw. *Only participants who took part in the games will be eligible for lucky draws.   What are you waiting for? Just put your books and lecture notes aside and join us in this fun and exciting event!   Detail of the Games  
Date Time Games Type
10-Oct-2012 19:00-22:00 Squash Single (Male/Female)
18:00-22:00 5 VS 5 Street Soccer Team
11-Oct-2012 18:00-21:45 Table Tennis Single (Male/Female)
Mixed Double
12-Oct-2012 19:30-21:45 Badminton Single (Male/Female)
Mixed Double
13-Oct-2012 16:00-22:00 Pool Single (Male/Female)
Mixed Double
15-Oct-12 17:30-22:00 3 VS 3 Basketball Team
16-Oct-12 17:30-22:00 Recreational Games Single
Closing Ceremony Date: 19 OCT 2012, Time: 18:00-21:00 Venue: LT20 Come and join us, you will get a chance to play new recreational games and stand to win our grand lucky draw!   Registration Registration is on a first come first basis and is now open. You can register by clicking on the following link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dGgyOFZuMWUyam5SMkhpNlprb2JOUmc6MQ Do register by 09 October 2012 to avoid disappointment   Alternatively For more information, you might want to visit our registration booth:
Date Time Venue
08-Oct-12 (Mon) 1130hrs to 1600hrs Canopy K (Outside LT1A)
09-Oct-12 (Tue) 1130hrs to 1600hrs Blk N4, Level 2 (outside SCEGeneral Office)
* More information will be sent upon confirmation. Hope to see you soon! Regards, Computer Engineering Club 13th Management Committee

sce-mass-walk-and-jog.name: sce-mass-walk-and-jog
sce-mass-walk-and-jog.title: SCE Mass Walk and Jog
sce-mass-walk-and-jog.content: Hi SCEians! TAKE A BREAK, HAVE A RUN! COME JOIN US AT SCE’s FIRST MARATHON, MASS WALK AND JOG!   Date: 30th October 2012, Tuesday Time: 5.45pm - 8pm Venue: Outside Tan Chin Tuan Lecture Theatre This event is aimed to promote a healthy lifestyle among the students. Throughout the years, it has been seen that under high pressures,many students crumble down; This event is a day when you can take a few hours out and head back to your studies feeling re-energized. ATTRACTIVE PRIZES TO BE WON! NO REGISTRATION FEES REQUIRED! REFRESHMENT WILL BE PROVIDED! WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR!? To register please click on the link below: https://wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/REGISTER_NTU.REGISTER?EVENT_ID=OA12102511202660 See you all there! Warm Regards, Computer Engineering Club 13th Management Committee

scene-is-now-out.name: scene-is-now-out

inter-school-games-sce-team-registration.name: inter-school-games-sce-team-registration
inter-school-games-sce-team-registration.title: Inter-School Games SCE Team Registration
inter-school-games-sce-team-registration.content:
Dear SCEians, Exams ended ! It's time for you to relax and enjoy yourself! You are invited to be part of our SCE Team for Inter-School Games (ISG). It will be a great chance to meet new people :) Here is the link for registration: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dENOaXduU2gzdFFUbTd2RjF2QVhFb0E6MQ#gid=0 Let's fight for the honor of our school together! (Female players are extremely needed!) A free SCE team shirt will be given to every team member and there are many exciting prizes for the winners! The detailed schedule is as follows:
Date Game
17 Dec 2012 Basketball (Male 5v5) (Female 3v3)
18 Dec 2012 Table Tennis
19 Dec 2012 Frisbee
20 Dec 2012 Badminton
21 Dec 2012 Netball; Volleyball
27 Dec 2012 Soccer(7 vs 7); Futsal (5v5)
28 Dec 2012 Tennis
2 Jan 2013 Tchoukball; Swimming
3 Jan 2013 Captain’s Ball
4 Jan 2013 Floorball; Volleyball
11 Jan 2013 Bowling
Training will commerce soon. It doesn't matter if you don't know how to play, as long as you are interested, you can be part of SCE team! Your team leader will contact you after your registration. Should you have any queries, please contact our Sports & Recreational Secretaries Wang Zeguo 85809747 c110054@e.ntu.edu.sg Li Weihao 97908750 wli3@e.ntu.edu.sg

inter-school-recreational-games-registra.name: inter-school-recreational-games-registration
inter-school-recreational-games-registra.title: Inter-School Recreational Games Registration
inter-school-recreational-games-registra.content: Dear SCEians   Winter holidays have come to an end and we hope that you have enjoyed your holidays. The beginning of this new semester marks a brand new chapter for Inter-School Games 2012/2013.   The annual Inter-School Recreational Games 2013 is finally here to greet you this January. Join us in this event and give another brilliant performance in the coming recreational games against other schools!   Details: Date: 28th Jan 2013 - 7th Feb 2013 Games available: *   International Chess *   Chinese Chess *   Blokus *   Othello *   Quarto *   Quoridor (NEW!)   *Time and venue for each game will be announced later. *Trainings will be provided for Quoridor participants on 24th Jan @ SAC Meeting Room 1 so do not worry if you have lost touch or have never played this board game before!   To register, click on the link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dHBlallHWDNzLWJ4aTBXS0h1aDQ3Y1E6MQ#gid=0   For enquires, please contact our Sports & Recreational Secretaries: Li Weihao – 97908750/WLI3@e.ntu.edu.sg Wang Zeguo – 85809747/C110054@e.ntu.edu.sg   Best regards, Computer Engineering Club 13th Management Committee

innovation-challenge-2013.name: innovation-challenge-2013
innovation-challenge-2013.title: Innovation Challenge 2013
innovation-challenge-2013.content: Dear SCEians,   Have ideas to change the world?   "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." Are you ready to take that step? Be brave. Be strong. Take the leap.   We proudly present SCE's Innovation Challenge, the platform you've been waiting for. Win up to $1000. Make your business ideas come true by giving it a chance of getting funded. Ready for the challenge? Then do it!  Registration link - http://goo.gl/9APdJ Need more details? Refer to the attached document. Or contact us at CEC-EVENTS@ntu.edu.sg. Attachment - Innovation Challenge Information & Rules   Best regards, Computer Engineering Club 13th Management Committee

hackathon-2013.name: hackathon-2013
hackathon-2013.title: Hackathon 2013
hackathon-2013.content: Hi SCEians, Announcing SCE's Hackathon! Organized in association with Reebonz, SCE is proud to have its first Hackathon.   Register in teams of up to 4 where one member may be from outside SCE. Sign up via http://goo.gl/OPgVH. Last date for registration is 12th Feb 2013.   Overview In teams of up to 4, in a 48 hour period, add a feature set to Reebonz, or prototype an innovative idea around the Reebonz API to stand a chance to win attractive prizes and geek fame! Reebonz will open up their API and production data for your use.   Perks 1. Code for glory. Compete for prizes. Show your peers what you've got. 2. Win cash prizes: 1st - $1000, 2nd - $500. Also, $50 Kwerkee credits for the first 20 people to sign up! 3. Stand a chance to score an internship with Reebonz. 4. Bond with teammates, network with other developers from school and from Reebonz. 5. Get a feel of "converting caffeine to code". 6. Get an insight as to what the industry wants and how to deliver.   Duration : From the evening of 15th to night of 17th February, 2013.   What are you waiting for? Sign up now! Contact Arnav Kumar at ARNAV1@e.ntu.edu.sg for more info.   Note: Hackathon is not to be confused with a similar event, Programming Competition. As a part of TechFest, CEC will also be organizing a 3 hour Programming Competition (which focuses on algorithms). Publicity for that will start soon. Watch out for emails!   Best regards, Computer Engineering Club 13th Management Committee

programming-competition.name: programming-competition
programming-competition.title: Programming Competition
programming-competition.content: Hi SCEians, Announcing SCE's Programming Competition, in association with J.P. Morgan. Register individually for a shot at glory! Sign up via http://goo.gl/tjbci Last date for registration is 18th Feb 2013. Please disregard the details in the previous email. Overview 2.5 hours. 12 Questions. Try solving as many questions as possible in the smallest possible time to stand a chance to win attractive prizes at recognition in the Programmers' Circle. Perks 1. Its all about honour. Compete with peers, and excercise your grey cells to solve the puzzling questions. 2. Win prizes: 1st - iPad mini, 2nd - $400 voucher, 3rd - $200 voucher. 3. Stand a chance to score an internship with J.P. Morgan. 4. Network and pick up pointers from NTU's superstar programmers from ACM ICPC. Date: 19th February, 2013 Time: 10am onwards Venue: SAC Meeting Room 3 What are you waiting for? Sign up now! Please take note that all participants will be sent a confirmation email with further details closer to the competition. Contact Arnav Kumar at ARNAV1@e.ntu.edu.sg<mailto:ARNAV1@e.ntu.edu.sg> for more info.     Regards, Computer Engineering Club 13th Management Committee (in association with J.P. Morgan)

sce-techfest.name: sce-techfest
sce-techfest.title: SCE TechFest!

ste-security-apps-challenge.name: ste-security-apps-challenge
ste-security-apps-challenge.title: STE Security Apps Challenge
ste-security-apps-challenge.content: Deadline for proposal submissions extended to 1 Sep 2013! The ST Electronics Security Apps Challenge aims to encourage youths to develop innovative mobile apps for Android-based smartphones. Scenarios consist of disaster relief and security patrol operations. This is an excellent opportunity for students to apply what they have learnt in the classroom and build their resumes at the same time. And of course, there are attractive prizes of up to S$8,000 to be won! For more information and application details, visit our website:  http://STElectronicsSecurityAppsChallenge.com

14th-cec-election.name: 14th-cec-election
14th-cec-election.title: 14th CEC Election
14th-cec-election.content:
Dear SCEians, Another year has passed and it is now time for a new Computer Engineering Club Management Committee to be formed. We sincerely hope you can show your support by attending the upcoming Election Rally on 24th and 26th August 2013 to see the potential leaders of the club. You are free to pose questions to the various nominees to ascertain their ability to carry out their respective responsibilities of the position that they are running for. The details of the Election Rally are as follows:   Day 1 Date: 24th August 2013 (Saturday) Time: 9am Venue: TBC   Day 2 Date: 26th August 2013 (Monday) Time: 8pm Venue: TBC   The Election Day will be on 29th August 2013 (Thursday). More details will be emailed to you at a later date.   If you have the following traits, you can be part of the next committee:
  • Strong leadership
  • Responsible individual
  • High level of integrity
  • Committed to serve the SCE community and school
  Please take note that you can send in your nominations at the CEC Welcome Week booth (around Nanyang Audi). Alternatively, a booth will be set up in front of SCE on 19th August 2013 (Monday) from 11am - 2pm. You are requested to submit a hard copy at the booth and a soft copy should be emailed to ANOOSHA1@e.ntu.edu.sg by 19th August 2013 (Monday) 5:00pm.   Attached the information sheet, job scope, and nomination form.
  • Information Sheet
  • 14th Management Job Scope
  • 14th Management Nomination Form
    •   We look forward to seeing you at the rally!   Regards,   13th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

sce-second-hand-book-sales.name: sce-second-hand-book-sales
sce-second-hand-book-sales.title: SCE Second Hand Book Sales
sce-second-hand-book-sales.content: Dear SCEians, With the beginning of this new semester, we are happy to bring back the Second Hand Book Sale!!!!! For seniors: No need to worry about how to deal with the books, just bring us your books and we will help you sell them. For freshman: Surprised by the high prices of the new books? Please do come to our Second Hand Book Sale to look for the books you need at much lower prices than the new ones. Following are the details for the time and location of our Second Hand Book Sale event: 1) Book collection: 20th August, 2013, 10:30am - 4:30pm 2) Book Preview 21th August, 2013 LINK: https://plus.google.com/u/0/photos/105524295698373923924/albums/6106456399741732513 Note: same as last semester, we will upload photos of all the books with the names, information on the website. So feel free to check the availability of the books you want before coming down to the sale. 3) Book Sale: 22th August, 2013, 10:30am - 4:30pm 4) Book/Money collection: 23th August, 2013, 12:30am - 4:30pm LOCATION: Outside SCE General Office, Level 2, N4   If you have any query, please email (lude0001@e.ntu.edu.sg).   Best Regards, 13th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

extended-lounge-hours.name: extended-lounge-hours
extended-lounge-hours.title: Extended Lounge Hours
extended-lounge-hours.content:
Dear SCEians,
been mugging hard? Why not mug with a mug of tea/coffee? The Computer Engineering Club is happy to announce we will be providing FREE coffee and teaonly at the Student Lounge to help in your exam preparation.
Moreover, we have heard your requests, and understand your needs for a place to study, hence we will be extending the Lounge's opening hours till 12 midnightfrom now till 6th Dec!
Venue: SCE Student Lounge
Time: 12pm to 6pm*
*Note: timing for the tea/coffee will be subjected to change based on response. As this is a pilot initiative we will continue to adjust it to ensure it benefit the maximum number of SCEians.
Warmest regards,
14th Management Committee
Computer Engineering Club

harcharan-singh-2014.name: harcharan-singh-2014
harcharan-singh-2014.title: Harcharan Singh 2014
harcharan-singh-2014.content:
Hello SCE-ians, Harcharan Singh 2014 has come to an end with our closing ceremony which was held on the 29th of October. We would like to thank everyone who came down to help for the event and also to the participants who made the games possible.

More details on SCE's Harcharan Singh!

Every year, Harcharan Singh aims to seek for talented people from SCE to join Inter School Games (ISG).  At the same time, Harcharan Singh also encourage more people who are interested in sports or recreational games to join the ISG during this December.  In some cases, one player from other schools can also join as a member of the team if required or interested. There were total of 10 different games which was held from 10-23 Oct:
  • 3v3 Basketball (3 or 4 players per team with at most one from outside SCE)
  • 5v5 Street soccer (6 players per team with at most one from outside SCE)
  • Table tennis (single and mixed double)
  • Pool game (single and mixed double)
  • Badminton (single and mixed double)
  • Scrabble (single)
  • Uno Stacko (single)
  • International Chess (single)
  • Chinese Chess (single)​
  • DotA2
This year Harcharan Singh had included DotA2 as one of the games. In addition, all people are welcome to participate the games as long as you are the staff or student from NTU. All recreational games were held on the first day of the events. For instance, students and staffs had came down to take on the challenges for the recreational games such as Uno Stacko, Scrabble, International chess and Chinese chess. Next, there were many different types of sports and was all held on different days as participants can join most of the games that they were interested with. In addition, many participants came down not only for the competitiveness but also for fun as well. Lastly, the closing ceremony and prize awards ceremony were held on the 29th October. During the ceremony, there was a lucky draw and also a buffet provided after the ceremony. Check out the photos below!

cec-exam-welfare-pack-2014.name: cec-exam-welfare-pack-2014
cec-exam-welfare-pack-2014.title: CEC Exam Welfare Pack 2014
cec-exam-welfare-pack-2014.content: Hello SCE-ians, The CEC Exam Welfare Pack 2014 was held on the month of November, we would like to thank our sponsors and committee helpers which were able to carry out this event with success! Our sponsors included many items in this year's exam welfare pack. Ranging from exam pads to pens, vouchers to speakers and many more! Check out our sponsors for CEC Exam Welfare Pack 2014 here. The response from our students this year were overwhelming! Students were queuing before the booth was opened. The queue went all the way around the corners and towards the back of SCE Lounge. Students were then required to verify that they were a student of SCE and also have liked our facebook page. Our student helpers were there to ensure that all that was happening smoothly. After which there were also other goodies provided by our various sponsors, like snacks and drinks for the students to enjoy. [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Helpers enjoying the food![/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Products from our sponsors[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Red bull girls![/caption] Check out the rest of our photos at our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.929195630473811.1073741839.210485992344782 We hope you enjoyed this year's EWP!

cdo-computer-workshop-series-for-seniors.name: cdo-computer-workshop-series-for-seniors
cdo-computer-workshop-series-for-seniors.title: CDO - Computer Workshop Series for Seniors
cdo-computer-workshop-series-for-seniors.content: Dear SCE-ians, Our club has recently held a 6 week workshop for senior citizens to learn the basics of using a computer with internet. The workshop included lessons like how to use paint, sending an email and many other basic lessons. The workshop was conducted purely in Chinese in hopes to be able to communicate better with the Chinese elderly in Taman Jurong CC. But since the response we had was quite good, we do have some plans in making a dual language class where we can communicate in both English and Chinese so that we are able to open the workshop up to more people. On the first and second week we taught the seniors on the most basics of using a computer and also going through the installation of certain softwares that we will be using throughout the workshop On the third week, we had lessons on how to use a digital writing pad to insert characters into the keyboard. As some of the seniors were not very well trained in using a keyboard, they found it more convenient to be able to write characters directly into the computer. [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="960"] Using the software and the digital writing pad to enter characters[/caption] On the fourth week, we taught the seniors on how to connect to the internet via Wi-Fi and also the basics of sending an email using their personal laptops On the fifth week, the seniors we taught on how to use Skype as a instant messenger and also a way to contact their loved ones through video calls. It was also the final lesson workshop as we have a mini-competition on the sixth week which tested on the knowledge which they have learnt so far. At the end of the fifth lesson, the instructors gave the seniors a refresh on all the lessons which they have learnt so far. On our last week of the workshop, a mini-competition was held. We had 5 different mini-games station which consisted of games that required skills of all the lessons that was taught to them throughout the workshop. The person who is able to complete all the games in the shortest time would be the winner of the competition. After which, a prize ceremony presentation was held and a certificate of appreciation was given out to all the helpers who were present throughout the workshop. A digital writing pad was also given out to all the senior citizens who attended this workshop. A token of appreciation was also given to the teachers who were presenting the lessons to the seniors by our club president. Kudos to them for sharing their knowledge! The whole workshop was a fun process for both the students and the teachers. We would like to thank all students that were able to give their free time to help out in such workshops. We also would like to encourage more students to attend and help out in such workshops, to be able to give back to our community. Check out the works done by the students of the workshop: If you would like to check out more photos of the workshop, do head over to our facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/cec.ntu/photos_stream?tab=photos_albums

sce-supper-hop.name: sce-supper-hop
sce-supper-hop.title: SCE Supper Hop
sce-supper-hop.content: Hello SCE-ians, The first ever Supper Hop exclusive to SCE students, was organized by the Computer Engineering Club and was held last week. The night activity consisted of two locations, one of which was Eminent Frog Porridge and the other was Ho Kee Pau. The trial started from NTU where our students took a chartered bus down towards Geylang. After that the students were split into groups and went to the respective assigned locations. After which everyone was given a pack of beancurd and a cup of grass jelly drink from Rochor Beancurd to end the event. The students were then brought back by a chartered bus back to NTU for a good night rest. We hope that everyone had fun on this trip and do provide us with feedback for improvement! Check out more of the photos here! - https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.986718388054868.1073741844.210485992344782&type=1

inter-school-games-1415.name: inter-school-games-1415
inter-school-games-1415.title: Inter School Games 14/15
inter-school-games-1415.content: Hello SCE-ians, We have just finished the Inter School Games(ISG) 14/15 during the semester break. The games which we participated included table tennis, volleyball, basketball and tchoukball. Players representing SCE were all given a pink colored shirt. [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="960"] In the middle of a volleyball game[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="960"] Players exchanging handshakes after the game[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="960"] Players for the guys basketball team[/caption] The games were all pretty exciting and fast paced. Every team played with their best efforts and we appreciate the effort of everyone representing Team SCE. After which, the closing ceremony was held yesterday on the 29th of January to thank everyone for their participation. The reception we had this year for the games were better than expected, we would like to thank everyone again on behalf of the CEC for helping to represent and participate in the ISG for SCE and we hope that the participants had fun during the games! Check out more of the photos here: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.978852152174825.1073741843.210485992344782&type=3

cec-1415-2nd-bonding-day.name: cec-1415-2nd-bonding-day
cec-1415-2nd-bonding-day.title: CEC 14/15 2nd Bonding Day
cec-1415-2nd-bonding-day.content: Hello SCE-ians, Our second CEC bonding day was held in mid February. A treasure hunt was held for the members in teams of portfolios and a laser tag competition was commenced afterwards. The laser tag was the main limelight for the event. We hope that everyone had fun during the event because I sure did! For the treasure hunt, each time needed to look for a folded paper star in the whole of NTU campus, thankfully there were photo hints provided to narrow down the search for each teams.   [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Photo hints of treasure hunt locations sent through whatsapp[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Students searching for the 'treasure item' all over NTU![/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] It was a race between teams! The team which wins gets an advantage in the laser tag round[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Whoever reached the endpoint of the treasure hunt first needs to take a selfie before ending the event[/caption]   And then after a short rest, after waiting for the laser tag vendors to arrive. We finally started our laser tag competition!   After a few round robins, the PnP + IT portfolio combo turned out to be the winners of the competition and the sole winner of the final event was Li Yichang! And after that we had dinner together with some yusheng and pizzas! We hoped everyone had fun during the event and we appreciated every member's attendance for this event! To check out more of this event's photos please take a look at our Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1001768476549859.1073741845.210485992344782&type=3

sce-techfest-2015.name: sce-techfest-2015
sce-techfest-2015.title: SCE Techfest 2015
sce-techfest-2015.content:
Hello SCE-ians, The SCE Techfest 2015 was held recently at the Nanyang Auditorium. Did you come down for our company showcases? Of course I'm sure some of you came down because of the free ice cream which we handed out! But the company showcases were pretty awesome, some booths also included some interesting gifts for the students! There were a few major events during the SCE Techfest which included:
  • Staff Award Ceremony
  • Hackathon
  • Stage Quizzes
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Students can find themselves learning more about companies and finding opportunities at the same time![/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] A dance game was setup on the Xbox 360 showcase to hold a mini competition for the highest score. The participants with the top 6 scores each gets to walk away with a $50 Capitaland voucher![/caption]   [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Commencement of the SCE Staff Award Ceremony. It was nice to see some of the long term staffs being awarded with a token of appreciation from the school.[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] After which came the buffet! Everyone was filling their tummies up after walking around the booth showcases[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] After the lunchtime events. The hackathon had already begun and the hackers all had their game faces on[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] An automated photobooth was also setup at the event to let our students take photos of themselves with their friends to leave some memories behind![/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2048"] Thank you for everyone who came down to help for the event! Much appreciated![/caption] The companies/clubs which were there to showcase their products were:
  • Version 2
  • FYND
  • FOMO Digital
  • JetBrains
  • OpenSource Society
  • C3
  • ArrowDynamic Labs
  • DSO
  • Tripda
  • PayWhere
  • ClassPlanner
  • SimTech
Thank you for everyone's participation, we hope to see everyone again next year!

exam-welfare-pack-s2-1415.title: Exam Welfare Pack S2 14/15

sce-dinner-dance-1516.name: sce-dinner-dance-1516
sce-dinner-dance-1516.title: SCE Dinner & Dance 15/16
sce-dinner-dance-1516.content: Dear SCE-ians, img class="aligncenter wp-image-2503 size-large" src="https://clubs.ntu.edu.sg/csec/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/11896301_527635887384069_4497026326739296349_o.jpg" alt="11896301_527635887384069_4497026326739296349_o" width="640" height="905" /> Mark your calendars for the 4th of September 2015 Friday 6pm, for SCE’s very own Dinner and Dance! Held at the Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre, Orchid Ballroom, this year’s theme is “Old Hollywood Glamour”. Come and join us for a night filled with games, performances, a chance to win attractive lucky draw prizes, and the highlight of the night – our very own pageant contest. Dress code is formal or according to theme, so be dressed in your best suits and dresses while we keep a look out for Mr & Ms SCE Best Dressed 2015! Tickets are priced at $30! There are limited seats available, so do register early to secure your seats and avoid disappointment!! You may register for the tickets through the following link by http://tinyurl.com/scednd2015. Join us in voting for the SCE Mr & Ms Popular 2015 @ https://www.facebook.com/scedinneranddance You may contact Chrysillia or Russell Loh for further information or enquires. (contact information in your email!) ​ Best Regards, 15th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

harcharan-singh-challenge-2015-intra-sch.name: harcharan-singh-challenge-2015-intra-school-game
harcharan-singh-challenge-2015-intra-sch.title: Harcharan Singh Challenge 2015 (Intra School Game)
harcharan-singh-challenge-2015-intra-sch.content:
Dear SCE-ians, Feeling stressed from your studies or work and in need of some relief? Seeking an opportunity to make more friends and at the same time have fun? Want to expose yourself to sports and recreational games? We have prepared a great platform for you to demonstrate your talents! Computer Engineering Club (CEC) proudly presents you with Harcharan Singh Challenge Games 2015 (HSG 2015). HSG is specially designed to promote bonding and interaction between students, staffs and alumni. Included in this event are 6 sports games and 4 recreational games. Sports games:
  1. 3v3 Basketball (3 or 4 players per team with at most one from outside SCE)
  2. 5v5 Street soccer (6 players per team with at most one from outside SCE)
  3. Tennis (single)
  4. Table tennis (single and mixed double)
  5. Pool game (single and mixed double)
  6. Badminton (single and mixed double)
Recreational games:
  1. Scrabble
  2. Uno Stacko
  3. International Chess
  4. Chinese Chess
Prizes and Welfares
  1. Winners and runners-up are awarded with Certificates and Medals.
  2. All participants will stand a chance to win Speakers, watches and mysterious prizes each game.
  3. All players will be provided with free drinks, snacks, T-shirts and goodie bags during the games.
  4. All participants will stand a chance to win lucky draws at the closing ceremony.
  5. All SCE student are invited to the closing ceremony to witness the final winners and runners-up, and enjoy free buffet together with the players.
Details
  • Target participants:All SCE professors, undergraduates and postgraduates
  • Date and Time:6pm onwards (after school), 7th Oct to 16th Oct
  • Online Registration:http://tinyurl.com/HSC15Registration
  • Schedule:http://tinyurl.com/HSC15Schedule
Should you have any questions with regard to the games, feel free to drop us an email at rchang001@e.ntu.edu.sg or simf0004@e.ntu.edu.sg. Thanks and we look forward to seeing you at the games Best Regards, 16th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

sce-shirt-design-contest-2015.name: sce-shirt-design-contest-2015
sce-shirt-design-contest-2015.title: SCE Shirt Design Contest 2015
sce-shirt-design-contest-2015.content:
Dear SCE-ians, Have you ever thought of being the designer of the official school T-shirt? Ever imagined seeing your fellow classmates wearing shirts that are designed by you? Now is your chance to show off your design talent with the SCE Shirt Design Contest! Simply send your design to us by email, and stand a chance to win a NTU Mascot Lyon. It can be as simple as a hand sketch, or as perfect as a watercolor masterpiece. We appreciate any kind of creativity, as long as it is clear enough to show your idea. Send in your design to sceclub@e.ntu.edu.sg with the following format:

Subject: SCE Shirt Design Contest Content: Include your full name, matriculation number and mobile number Attachment: Your design in JPEG form

The contest closes on 18 October. If your design is selected, you’ll receive a shirt of your design for free. Why wait! Start the design now and let other SCE-ians see your stunning work!     Best regards, 16th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

sce-ocip-2016-recruitment-drive.name: sce-ocip-2016-recruitment-drive
sce-ocip-2016-recruitment-drive.title: SCE OCIP 2016 Recruitment Drive
sce-ocip-2016-recruitment-drive.content:
Dear SCE-ians, Having a loving heart? Want to contribute to the society? Want to go overseas with friends during the long holidays?

YES! WE WANT YOU! SCE Overseas Community Involvement Project (OCIP) 2016 IS NOW OPEN FOR RECRUITMENT! We are looking for proactive members who are able to contribute well to the team like you!

So what are you waiting for? Sign up now and join the team! Positions available are:
  1. Business managers
  2. Programmers
  3. Welfare officer
  4. Logistic officer
  5. Publicity and publication officer
Click here for more details of the positions. Do come down for our interview at TR-25 on the 19th & 20th October between 6.30pm to 9pm! Registrations can be done through this web link https://goo.gl/ydBVOV. We hope to see you there! Additionally, if you’re interested and unavailable to make it for the allocated time slots, do drop us an email so that we can make special arrangements if time permits. For further enquiries, feel free to contact us! Neo Yeow Yang (President)    - C140130@e.ntu.edu.sg Zhang Xinyi (Vice-President) - XZHANG034@e.ntu.edu.sg Warmest regards, 4th Management Committee | CEC-OCIP@e.ntu.edu.sg SCE Overseas Communities Involvement Project

sce-foc-1617-main-committee-recruitment.title: SCE FOC 16/17 Main Committee Recruitment

Regards, Valerie Leo | President Freshmen Orientation Camp 2016/2017 School of Computer Engineering Nanyang Technological University 9222 4939 | vleo001@e.ntu.edu.sg

kokomama-marketplace-student-super-combo.name: kokomama-marketplace-student-super-combo
kokomama-marketplace-student-super-combo.title: KOKOMAMA Marketplace Student Super COMBO!!!
kokomama-marketplace-student-super-combo.content: Dear SCE-ians, What’s the best way to recover from the relentless projects and assignment week after week? They say that food is the best way to motivate and push people! Each meal comes with a main course, accompanied by a cup of drink and dessert! Refer to the attached posters, and check out the following links for more details! https://www.facebook.com/kokomama.marketplace Best regards, 16th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

exam-welfare-package-is-here.name: exam-welfare-package-is-here
exam-welfare-package-is-here.title: Exam Welfare Package is here!
exam-welfare-package-is-here.content:
Dear SCE-ians,

It's the time of the semester yet again! The Computer Engineering Club has specially prepared your Exam Welfare Packages to spur you on in your studies for your final exams! 

The event will be held on 3rd November 2015, this coming Tuesday, from 1130 to 1430 at the SCE Lounge! 

There will be FREE Chewy Junior Cream Puffs sponsored by the Students Affairs Office and the School of Computer Engineering for you to enjoy as well!!!

So do mark this date down on your calendar and remember to bring your Matriculation Card along to collect your goodies on that day. We shall see you! 

Cheers, The 16th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

sce-shirt-pre-order-is-open-now.name: sce-shirt-pre-order-is-open-now
sce-shirt-pre-order-is-open-now.title: SCE Shirt Pre-order is open now!
sce-shirt-pre-order-is-open-now.content:
Dear SCE-ians,

The long-awaited SCE shirts are open for your pre-order now!

Available in four colors, the shirts cater to your preference with black/gold, dark green/yellow,  maroon/white, and mélange(grey)/maroon (click to see the shirt). It is made from high quality cotton with a soft texture and a low shrinkage rate.

The shirt is sold at S$10.00 per piece. The first 200 pre-ordered shirts will also come with one free limited-edition SCE card sticker per shirt. Order the whole set of shirts or order with your friends to enjoy more discount – 2 shirts at S$18.00 and 4 shirts at S$35.00! Moreover, the first 100 pre-orders can also receive an additional one dollar off the total deal on top of other promotions. Payment will only be made on the date of collection.

Scan the QR code to read through the Pre-order Terms and Conditions for more details. Place your pre-order now to be the first batch wearing the new SCE shirt and enjoy early bird promotion and more! The link for pre-order is https://goo.gl/xvtTOv.

Should you have any question regarding shirt pre-order please contact us at cec-business@e.ntu.edu.sg.

Best Regards, 16thManagement Committee Computer Engineering Club ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About Trendink

At Trendink, we are proud to offer you custom apparel manufacturing & printing services and are ever ready to assist you with your apparel needs!

Trendink was founded in 2014 with 3 simple philosophies: Comfort, Style and Uniqueness. We focus on providing an AWESOME customer’s experience by understanding customers’ needs, and creating quality and affordable apparel.

sce-ocip-vietnam-recruitment-drive-2016.name: sce-ocip-vietnam-recruitment-drive-2016
sce-ocip-vietnam-recruitment-drive-2016.title: SCE OCIP (Vietnam), Recruitment Drive 2016
sce-ocip-vietnam-recruitment-drive-2016.content: Dear SCE-ians, Not sure of what to do during the holidays? Want to have some fun, make new friends and forge everlasting memories? Want to do something meaningful and contribute back to society? Join us for this summer break’s overseas community involvement programme! SCE OCIP 16 recruitment drive is now open for registrations! We’re looking for proactive members are willing to contribute and gain new experience through the process! Location of the interview will be at Tr+8 on 18th & 19th Jan 2016 from 6:30pm to 9pm. Portfolio details are as attached! Brief details of the trip: Activities: Assist in construction of outdoor playground & garden as well as facilitating lessons for primary school kids Overseas partner: Vietnam, Phong Thanh Commune Date: Late May – early June Like us on Facebook or visit our web for more information! So what are you waiting for? Be part of this rewarding experience and grow as an individual! Warmest regards, 4th Management Committee | CEC-OCIP@e.ntu.edu.sg NTU SCE Overseas Communities Involvement Project

exam-welfare-pack-s1-20152016.name: exam-welfare-pack-s1-20152016
exam-welfare-pack-s1-20152016.title: Exam Welfare Pack S1 2015/2016
exam-welfare-pack-s1-20152016.content:
Hello SCE-ians,

Did you manage to collect your Exam Welfare Pack for this semester? Seems like this semester’s EWP was as overwhelming as the last few semesters’. And we should give a big thanks to our sponsors that provided us all those goodies for this semester!

Our sponsors can be seen by clicking on this link.

The day students had fun together with their friends while collecting their Exam Welfare Pack.

Guess what? This semester, the Students Affairs Office and the School of Computer Engineering had sponsored FREE Chewy Junior Cream Puffs for everyone to enjoy! So did you manage to grab some of this sweets puffs while collecting your EWP last Tuesday?

FREE Chewy Junior

For more of our pictures, you can click on this link here.

We hope that all of you had enjoyed the EWP distribution day last Tuesday and here’s wishing all of you GOOD LUCK for your exams. (:

sce-members-day.name: sce-members-day
sce-members-day.title: SCE MEMBER'S DAY
sce-members-day.content: Dear SCE-ians, Interested to know more about Computer Engineering Club and win vouchers? Here you go! CEC will be bringing you the annual SCE MEMBER'S DAY on 19th January 2016 (Tuesday). You are cordially invited to SCE Student Lounge from 1130 to 1400 hours. Look out for members from our club's portfolios for our upcoming events and networking. If you are interested to know more about our portfolios like what they do, come down and meet them and enjoy the refreshments provided such as chocolate eclairs and puffs. On top of that, CEC will be organising 'SCEGram 2016' competition where you will stand a chance to win $20 CapitaLand vouchers by posting photos of your SCE daily life and put on a creative description on Instagram with hashtag #scegram2016. The top 3 best description and the top most popular liked photo will each win the voucher. Competition will end on 19th January 2016 2359 hours and winners will be notified through CEC Facebook page. Hope to see you there! Best Regards, 16th Management Committee Computer Engineering Club

sce-ocip-valentines-roses.name: sce-ocip-valentines-roses
sce-ocip-valentines-roses.title: SCE OCIP Valentine's Roses
sce-ocip-valentines-roses.content:
Dear SCE-ians, Our very own SCE OCIP will be embarking on their overseas CIP project during the semester break coming May 25th in Vietnam, Phong Thanh Commune. Our team will be assisting in the construction of an outdoor playground & garden and also conducting educational lessons for primary school kids in the village. As part of the team’s fund raising events, we are proud to bring to you our very own valentines’ day roses. All profits from this event will go to funding the community project. Below are the prices for the roses:
  • 1 Stalk ($3.50) [ complimentary "flowery" transparent wrapper ]
  • 3 Stalks ($10) [ +$2 bouquet wrap ]
  • 5 Stalks ($15) [ +$4 bouquet wrap ]
  • 10 Stalks ($28) [ +$6 bouquet wrap ]
Do register your orders @ http://bit.do/sceroses2016! Every little contribution counts! “No act of kindness, however small, is ever wasted ” So do join us and support our cause through this event to raise funds for the community in Vietnam, Phong Thanh Commune. For any queries, feel free to contact us and thank you for your support! Warmest regards, 4th Management Committee | CEC-OCIP@e.ntu.edu.sg NTU SCE Overseas Communities Involvement Project

scse-dinner-dance-2019.name: scse-dinner-dance-2019
scse-dinner-dance-2019.title: SCSE Dinner & Dance 2019
scse-dinner-dance-2019.content:
SCSE Dinner & Dance 2019     The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) hosted its annual Dinner & Dance on 11th September 19 at the Novotel Singapore on Stevens. The annual Dinner & Dance is always seen as the event to look forward to for undergraduates as it marks an important milestone in their varsity life. The annual University event catered to a total of 200 attendees, offers SCSE students and staff to bond, catch up and have a fun-filled night to remember. The theme of this year’s Dinner & Dance was “Tesoro Mio” an Italian translation of “treasure mine”, “my darling”, “my sweetheart”. The organizing committee aims to get everyone to let their hair down and enjoy themselves, many SCSE students and staff were seen all dressed up for the occasion.   The organizing committee worked hard to create a stunning photo booth to invoke a sense of romanticism in the guests and it was well-received, among both students and staff.  
Students enjoying the photo booth at the annual event during the reception of the event
     SCSE Associate Chair (Students), Assoc Prof Quek Hiok Chai graced the event as the Guest of Honour for Dinner & Dance 2019. As with any D&D, the highlight of the many awards was the coveted title of SCSE King and Queen of the academic year 2019/20.     Miss Singapore International 19, Charlotte Lucille Chia, was cordially invited to grace the contest as our Special Guest Judge. An additional two pairs of titles were conferred in this year’s D & D - Mr/Ms. Congeniality and Mr/Ms. Photogenic. Taking in the form of 16 pageant contestants, this year’s D&D King and Queen hopefuls competed to a series of segments and performance; consisting of pageant walks, individual poses, couple poses and a dance. The venue was filled with loud cheers & fun-filled laughter from their loyal supporters. Finally, Aloysius Seow & Joey Lim were crowned King and Queen.       SCSE Queen: Joey Lim, DSAI Year 1 (left); SCSE King: Aloysius Seow, CS Year 1 (right); Group Photo of judges with pageant contestant (bottom) Everyone enjoyed themselves with exciting games, delicious food and attractive prizes won during the lucky draw. The dinner was a memorable night with exciting games, breath-taking performances, wonderful food, and great company

21st-main-committee.name: 21st-main-committee
21st-main-committee.title: 21st Main Committee
21st-main-committee.content:
Introducing the 21st Main Committee

[gallery size="medium" ids="1186,1180,1189,1181,1182,1184,1187,1226,1185,1183,1190,1188,1191,1192,1193,1194,1197,1179,1195,1196,1199"]

Mission of 21st Main Committee

School of Computer Science and Engineering Club (CSEC Club) is a student organisation established to improve the welfare and student lives of SCSE Students. We aim to enrich student’s university life, meet students’ needs, be the voice of SCSE-ians.

techterview-101-navigating-the-internshi.name: techterview-101-navigating-the-internship-world
techterview-101-navigating-the-internshi.title: Techterview 101: Navigating the Internship World
techterview-101-navigating-the-internshi.content:
Techterview 101: Navigating the Internship World, a senior sharing event for the SCSE students took place on the 24th of February 2022. The event had an audience of over 150 participants eagerly listening to valuable tips provided by their seniors who have achieved great successes in their lives. Abhishek Bhagwat, Maggie Koesno and Johnson Foo shared about their experiences searching for internships and also provided little tips, tricks and pointers to keep in mind when one ventures in a search for the best internship for them.

The inquisitive audience posed the speakers with multitudinous questions to which the speakers gladly answered. These answers are available at https://bit.ly/TechterviewQandA.

This pioneer event was conducted smoothly by the SCSE Club Academic Committee. The team also shared some insight into platforms like LeetCode. A mock interview was conducted by the sub committee to educate the audience on the Do’s and Don’ts during a technical interview.

We hope this event was beneficial to the students and hope to conduct more in the future!
